messages.title: Fighting for our area
messages.content: Lib Dem Neil Bradbury is campaigning hard for our area. Neil and the local Liberal Democrats team have been setting out plans including Gateshead Council's Labour-run Park and Ride scheme and cuts to our local bus routes.

messages.title: NEIL'S LIB DEMS CAN WIN HERE...
messages.content: Our area is a closely fought race between the Liberal Democrats and Labour. The choice at the next election is either Neil Bradbury and the Lib Dems or more of the same under Labour.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Neil Bradbury would fight for better rail links for the North East, focusing on the introduction of essential local rail routes.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Conservatives finished in a distant third place in Blaydon Constituency at the last General Election. Only the Lib Dems can beat Labour in our area.

housing.content: Labour-run Park and Ride scheme and cuts to our local bus routes.

politicalExperience.achievements: A track record of fighting for vital local issues, such as a member of the Tyne Valley Rail Users Group, TWITA and have stood tall at local demos.

contactInformation.address: Neil Bradbury, Liberal Democrats, FREEPOST NEA 10304, Gateshead, NE9 5BR

images.caption: Neil Bradbury with supporters giving thumbs up.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet makes strategic electoral claims highlighting that only the Lib Dems can beat Labour in the area, suggesting a two-horse race and dismissing the Conservatives as unable to win.
